intro: Fernandezia breviconnata, commonly known as the short-veined fern, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to the island of Fernando de Noronha, an archipelago off the coast of Brazil. The plant is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit and small, aromatic leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink and are clustered in dense inflorescences. Fernandezia breviconnata is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and limited distribution.
